page.title: 17HISTORIC PLACES
page.content: {ROMAN TESSELLATED PAVEMENT-}Now covered by rough vegetation it lies adjacent to the garden of 20 North Street, Roxby. A copy of a{coloured {engraving}of the pavement is preserved in the church. The pavement is approx 6m wide and of proportionate length. It is composed of red, blue and white tesserae positioned in circles and quadrangles with urns, flowers, keys, and knotwork within these shapes, set in a floor of lime and sand.{ {LOST VILLAGE_ }There is a small area of land close by High Risby farmhouse which was rhe site of a{medieval {village.}It is covered in grass and is too uneven to be ploughed. {DOVE COTE-}Present in the grounds of Low Risby farmhouse which has served several purposes-the housing of farm workers and 10 German prisoners during the{2nd World War.
